ncsd_output_reader.py¶

Contains a function which reads data from ncsd output files.

Also contains a couple small functions for getting names of nuclei.

ncsd_python.plot_modules.ncsd_output_reader.element_name(Z)¶

Gets the name of an element. Currently only works up to Z=30.

Z:

integer, number of protons

>> element_name(1)
H
ncsd_python.plot_modules.ncsd_output_reader.nucleus_name(Z, N)¶

Returns the name of a nucleus.

Z:

integer, number of protons

N:

integer, number of neutrons

>> nucleus_name(3, 5)
Li8
ncsd_python.plot_modules.ncsd_output_reader.read_all_ncsd_output(real_paths)¶

Runs read_ncsd_output for many paths in case you have a few different files then tries to merge data at the end.

real_paths:

absolute paths to ncsd output files

ncsd_python.plot_modules.ncsd_output_reader.read_ncsd_output(filename)¶

Parses ncsd output.

filename:

path to ncsd output file

Eventually returns a dictionary of the form:

dict = {
    "element_name": "B",
    "nucleus_name": "B11",
    "Z": 5,
    "N": 6,
    "Z_plus_N": 11,
    "n_states": 10,
    "filename": "filename",
    "interaction_name": "n3lo-NN3Nlnl-srg2.0"
    "calculated_spectrum": {
        Nmax: {
            state_num: [
                J(angular momentum),
                Repetition,
                Parity,
                Energy
            ],
        }
    }
}
